div.ab: Half an ℥ of stavesacre for common dogs, & one ℥ for big ones, as fine powder beaten with two egg oil whites & one quarteron of oil. Make them drink on an empty stomach, having kept them locked up at night without eating. Approved.

div.head: For casting
div.ab: If you have some piece which will not release, & is big, mold it with wax, either in hollow or in relief, because it is malleable once soft & obeys, and thus separates itself from the piece without leaving anything. But take heed that the melted wax be neither too hot nor too cold. Some mold with wax heated in hot water, but in pressing, the mold becomes clumsy & makes itself false. When you have the hollow wax form, you can cast in some very soft clay & very moistened & clear, & let it dry at ease. Then you will make a hollow form on it ave of lead or tin, in tu which what you will form will be of good release.
Know what it is to do spangling work: it is scales of pure silver & of gilt silver with which one makes the archers’ haquetons.

div.head: Spinet playing by itself
div.ab: Make an axle surrounded with wheels pierced all around the edge and attach quills as for a cittern or a spinet, & arrange them according to the song you want to be said, leaving telle a suitable distance between. And, turning the axle either by yourself or by a clock spring, your invention will be effected.
